issue.title: Remove websocker-driver dependency
issue.body:
It appears that this should never have been here - It was required to support some celluloid code, but celluloid was optional anyway, and the celluloid code has since been removed.

Resolves #431

issue.title: Renamed CLI to Cli and incremented version to 2.1.0.
issue.body:
Renamed `CLI` to `Cli` to match `Api`, otherwise it feels like a constant. 

Incremented version since this is a significant change, although not backwards-compatibility-breaking since no external behavior changed.

Here's an example of a CHANGELOG.md entry: ```markdown * [#435](https://github.com/slack-ruby/slack-ruby-client/pull/435): Renamed cli to cli and incremented version to 2.1.0 - [@dblock](https://github.com/dblock). ```

issue.title: fix GLI usage breaking faraday >= 2.7.0
issue.body:
when using include at the top level, the module gets included in the Object class

`Faraday::Middleware` checks whether it responds to `on_error`, which then finds GLI's `on_error`, which has a different signature and meaning

this resolves that by wrapping the entire CLI in a class so that `GLI::App` is not included in `Object`

we also use GLI's built-in `commands_from` method to avoid having to reference every command file individually

Resolves #433

Note: The `slack:web:api:update` task seemed to want to pull in some new stuff - since that usually seems to be done separately I have intentionally excluded that but can include it if you want

comment.body:
1 Error
:no_entry_sign: One of the lines below found in CHANGELOG.md doesn't match the expected format. Please make it look like the other lines, pay attention to version numbers, periods, spaces and date formats.

issue.title: Update GitHub Actions to latest versions
issue.body:
Using the latest version of [actions/checkout](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/checkout) will resolve the `Node.js 12 actions are deprecated` warnings.

Ruby version in `.ruby-version` is used by [ruby/setup-ruby](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/setup-ruby-jruby-and-truffleruby) automatically when not otherwise specified.

Addresses #426

issue.title: Delete obsolete endpoints and commands
issue.body: The `slack:web:api:update` task currently doesn't touch previous endpoints, endpoint specs, or commands if they no longer have any current Web API methods, so there are some empty classes and classes with all obsolete methods.

issue.title: Update real_time.rake to remove outdated event hooks and organize alphabetically
issue.body:
The `slack:real_time:api:update` task currently doesn't touch previous hooks and only prepends new event handler templates at the top of the store. The result is that many of the hooks currently in the stores are for Slack events that no longer exist or have outdated documentation. Additionally, there is no consistent ordering.

This PR makes the task more intelligent to extract all the current hooks and reuse only the hooks themselves while always generating fresh documentation and arranging the hooks in alphabetical order. Any hooks not matching the current Slack API ref are discarded.

This sets up updating some hook implementations for changes in #423

issue.title: Api ref update
issue.body:
Adds new RTM API events:

- [user_status_changed](https://api.slack.com/events/user_status_changed)
- [user_profile_changed](https://api.slack.com/events/user_profile_changed)
- [user_huddle_changed](https://api.slack.com/events/user_huddle_changed)

Adds new Web API methods:

- [admin.audit.anomaly.allow.getItem](https://api.slack.com/methods/admin.audit.anomaly.allow.getItem)
- [admin.audit.anomaly.allow.updateItem](https://api.slack.com/methods/admin.audit.anomaly.allow.updateItem)
- [files.completeUploadExternal](https://api.slack.com/methods/files.completeUploadExternal)
- [files.getUploadURLExternal](https://api.slack.com/methods/files.getUploadURLExternal)

Updates many method arguments including some conditionally-required arguments (requires one of several) on views.

issue.title: Enable fragments
issue.body:
@dblock  I have added some logic to resolve constants defined in a different context, provided that the full namespace path is included on `Graphlient::Query::#parse`, although `stub_const` doesn't seem to offer a way to mock the scenario.

```ruby
module Test
  module Foo
    module Bar
      Fragment = "client.parse ..."
    end
  end
end

module Test
  module Foo
    module Baz
      # use of ___Bar__Fragment
      puts Bar::Fragment
    end
  end
end
```

In the example above, a graphlient.parse in `Baz` referring to `___Bar__Fragment` would fail to resolve. And for this reason, I have added `evaluate` (capture the context) and `resolve_fragment_constant` (constant resolution + type validation).
  * I am using `Graphlient::Errors:Error` for the type validation, but you may see this requires its own error type. so I have not added `spec` to `raise`.

issue.title: Api ref update
issue.body:
Adds new RTM API events:

- [user_status_changed](https://api.slack.com/events/user_status_changed)
- [user_profile_changed](https://api.slack.com/events/user_profile_changed)
- [user_huddle_changed](https://api.slack.com/events/user_huddle_changed)

Adds new Web API methods:

- [admin.audit.anomaly.allow.getItem](https://api.slack.com/methods/admin.audit.anomaly.allow.getItem)
- [admin.audit.anomaly.allow.updateItem](https://api.slack.com/methods/admin.audit.anomaly.allow.updateItem)
- [files.completeUploadExternal](https://api.slack.com/methods/files.completeUploadExternal)
- [files.getUploadURLExternal](https://api.slack.com/methods/files.getUploadURLExternal)

Updates many method arguments including some conditionally-required arguments (requires one of several) on views.

issue.title: Enable fragments
issue.body:
@dblock  I have added some logic to resolve constants defined in a different context, provided that the full namespace path is included on `Graphlient::Query::#parse`, although `stub_const` doesn't seem to offer a way to mock the scenario.

```ruby
module Test
  module Foo
    module Bar
      Fragment = "client.parse ..."
    end
  end
end

module Test
  module Foo
    module Baz
      # use of ___Bar__Fragment
      puts Bar::Fragment
    end
  end
end
```

In the example above, a graphlient.parse in `Baz` referring to `___Bar__Fragment` would fail to resolve. And for this reason, I have added `evaluate` (capture the context) and `resolve_fragment_constant` (constant resolution + type validation).
  * I am using `Graphlient::Errors:Error` for the type validation, but you may see this requires its own error type. so I have not added `spec` to `raise`.

issue.title: fix GLI usage breaking faraday >= 2.7.0
issue.body:
when using include at the top level, the module gets included in the Object class

`Faraday::Middleware` checks whether it responds to `on_error`, which then finds GLI's `on_error`, which has a different signature and meaning

this resolves that by wrapping the entire CLI in a class so that `GLI::App` is not included in `Object`

we also use GLI's built-in `commands_from` method to avoid having to reference every command file individually

Resolves #433

Note: The `slack:web:api:update` task seemed to want to pull in some new stuff - since that usually seems to be done separately I have intentionally excluded that but can include it if you want

issue.title: Update GitHub Actions to latest versions
issue.body:
Using the latest version of [actions/checkout](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/checkout) will resolve the `Node.js 12 actions are deprecated` warnings.

Ruby version in `.ruby-version` is used by [ruby/setup-ruby](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/setup-ruby-jruby-and-truffleruby) automatically when not otherwise specified.

Addresses #426

issue.title: Delete obsolete endpoints and commands
issue.body: The `slack:web:api:update` task currently doesn't touch previous endpoints, endpoint specs, or commands if they no longer have any current Web API methods, so there are some empty classes and classes with all obsolete methods.

Generated by :no_entry_sign: Danger

issue.title: Update real_time.rake to remove outdated event hooks and organize alphabetically
issue.body:
The `slack:real_time:api:update` task currently doesn't touch previous hooks and only prepends new event handler templates at the top of the store. The result is that many of the hooks currently in the stores are for Slack events that no longer exist or have outdated documentation. Additionally, there is no consistent ordering.

This PR makes the task more intelligent to extract all the current hooks and reuse only the hooks themselves while always generating fresh documentation and arranging the hooks in alphabetical order. Any hooks not matching the current Slack API ref are discarded.

This sets up updating some hook implementations for changes in #423

issue.title: Enable fragments
issue.body:
@dblock  I have added some logic to resolve constants defined in a different context, provided that the full namespace path is included on `Graphlient::Query::#parse`, although `stub_const` doesn't seem to offer a way to mock the scenario.

```ruby
module Test
  module Foo
    module Bar
      Fragment = "client.parse ..."
    end
  end
end

module Test
  module Foo
    module Baz
      # use of ___Bar__Fragment
      puts Bar::Fragment
    end
  end
end
```

In the example above, a graphlient.parse in `Baz` referring to `___Bar__Fragment` would fail to resolve. And for this reason, I have added `evaluate` (capture the context) and `resolve_fragment_constant` (constant resolution + type validation).
  * I am using `Graphlient::Errors:Error` for the type validation, but you may see this requires its own error type. so I have not added `spec` to `raise`.
